The video evidence: The expert analyzed the video shared on Facebook, which showed four men dressed in women's clothing being escorted by the police. The video was examined to determine the authenticity of the claim.
News reports: The expert found a report from Navbharat Times, published on August 26, 2019, which provided additional information about the incident. The report stated that the men dressed as women were beaten by villagers who suspected them of being child-kidnappers. This news report helped verify the true nature of the incident.
Corroborating evidence: The expert discovered another video of the same incident from a different time-frame, which confirmed that the video in question was indeed from Dheeg village. This additional evidence supported the conclusion that the men in the video were not child-kidnappers but individuals who had been mistaken for such.
Eyewitness testimonies: The expert found comments on the video from individuals who stated that the men dressed as women were part of a religious dance troupe and had come to their village to perform. These eyewitness testimonies contradicted the claim that the men were child-kidnappers and provided further evidence to support the expert's verdict.
